intro: Lastrea himalayensis, commonly known as the Himalayan lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces a milky sap that contains cardiac glycosides. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
